abstract: The G.A.O. would have 100 days to review the action, which can be expected to stoke a debate about American jobs and military competitiveness in an election year.
snippet: The G.A.O. would have 100 days to review the action, which can be expected to stoke a debate about American jobs and military competitiveness in an election year.
lead_paragraph: CHICAGO  Boeing said Monday that it would protest the Air Force’s award of a $35 billion contract to build aerial refueling planes to a group that includes its European rival Airbus.

headline.main: Boeing Says It Will Protest Tanker Deal
headline.print_headline: Boeing Says It’ll Protest Tanker Deal

byline.original: By Jeff Bailey and David M. Herszenhorn

abstract: In a CNBC interview, Louis Gallois, chief executive of EADS, defends a $35 billion tanker contract with the United States Air Force.
snippet: In a CNBC interview, Louis Gallois, chief executive of EADS, defends a $35 billion tanker contract with the United States Air Force.
lead_paragraph: In a CNBC interview, Louis Gallois, chief executive of EADS, defends a $35 billion tanker contract with the United States Air Force.
